p: The major chemical families of the J. virginiana EO constituents were monoterpene hydrocarbons (MH), phenylpropene (PH), sesquiterpenes (bicyclic, monocyclic oxygenated ST), and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PCH) ( Table 3). During the first 5 min of the distillation, about 43% of the monoterpenes (e.g. limonene) were eluted. The quantity of the monoterpenes elution gradually decreased as the distillation time increased, and it reached the bottom (15.6%) at 240 min. Limonene concentration at the 0–5 min timeframe was 177% higher than that eluted at 160–240 min timeframe fraction.
